IClaims","name":"_claims","type":"address"}],"name":"setClaimsContract","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_token","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_oracle","type":"address"}],"name":"setOracle","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_localDisputeID","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"string","name":"_evidenceURI","type":"string"}],"name":"submitEvidence","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_localDisputeID","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"string[]","name":"_evidences","type":"string[]"}],"name":"submitMultipleEvidence","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"name":"tokenToOracle","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"winnerStakeMultiplier","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_localDisputeID","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address payable","name":"_beneficiary","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_round","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_ruling","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawFeesAndRewards","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"reward","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_localDisputeID","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address payable","name":"_contributor","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"_contributedTo","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_localDisputeID","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address payable","name":"_contributor","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_roundNumber","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"withdrawFeesAndRewardsForMultipleRulings","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"This contract acts a connector between Unslashed and Kleros court. NOTE: This contract trusts that the Arbitrator is honest and will not reenter or modify its costs during a call. The arbitrator must support appeal period. The contract also trusts that Claims and Market contracts are honest and won't reenter.","methods":{"acceptClaim(uint256)":{"details":"Accept the claim that wasn't challenged during the challenge period.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the claim."}},"challengeClaim(uint256,string[])":{"details":"Challenge the claim and create a dispute. Requires the value of the arbitration cost as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the claim to challenge.","_evidences":"A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided."}},"changeChallengeTimeout(uint256)":{"details":"Change the duration of the challenge period.","params":{"_challengeTimeout":"The new duration of the challenge period."}},"changeClaimantMultiplier(uint256)":{"details":"Change the proportion of the requested amount that must be paid by the claimant in order to create a new claim.","params":{"_claimantMultiplier":"The new multiplier for calculating the claimant's deposit. In basis points."}},"changeGovernor(address)":{"details":"Change the governor of the contract.","params":{"_governor":"The address of the new governor."}},"changeLoserStakeMultiplier(uint256)":{"details":"Change the proportion of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake by the party that lost the previous round.","params":{"_loserStakeMultiplier":"The new multiplier of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake. In basis points."}},"changeMetaEvidence(string)":{"details":"Update the meta evidence used for disputes.","params":{"_metaEvidence":"URI of the new meta evidence."}},"changeMinimumDeposit(uint256)":{"details":"Change the minimum deposit the claimant has to pay when the claimed value is too low.","params":{"_minimumDeposit":"The new minimum deposit for claimant."}},"changeReadjustmentTimeout(uint256)":{"details":"Change the duration of the readjustment period.","params":{"_readjustmentTimeout":"The new duration of the readjustment period."}},"changeWinnerStakeMultiplier(uint256)":{"details":"Change the proportion of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake by the winner of the previous round. Also applies in case of a draw.","params":{"_winnerStakeMultiplier":"The new multiplier of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake. In basis points."}},"fundAppeal(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Take up to the total amount required to fund a side of an appeal. Reimburse the rest. Create an appeal if both sides are fully funded.","params":{"_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.","_ruling":"The ruling to contribute to."},"returns":{"fullyFunded":"Whether the side of an appeal was fully funded or not."}},"getAppealCost(uint256)":{"details":"Get the cost of appeal of the claims' dispute.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the associated claim."},"returns":{"appealCost":"to be paid. Note that this cost doesn't include crowdfunding fees."}},"getChallengeCost(uint256)":{"details":"Get the deposit required for challenging the claim.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the associated claim."},"returns":{"challengeCost":"to be paid."}},"getClaimCost(address,uint256)":{"details":"Get the cost of making a claim.","params":{"_amount":"The claimed amount.","_marketAddress":"The address of the market to define the token address."},"returns":{"deposit":"The fraction of the claimed amount converted into ETH."}},"getClaimantDeposit(address,uint256)":{"details":"Get the required deposit for the claimant.","params":{"_amount":"The amount to convert into ETH.","_marketAddress":"The address of the market to define the token address."},"returns":{"_0":"The deposit the claimant has to pay."}},"getContributions(uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"Get the contributions made by a party for a given round of a dispute.","params":{"_contributor":"The address of the contributor.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the dispute in the array of disputes.","_round":"The round to query."},"returns":{"contributions":"The contributions."}},"getMultipliers()":{"details":"Returns stake multipliers.","returns":{"_loserAppealPeriodMultiplier":"Multiplier for calculating the duration of the appeal period for losing side. This contract uses default 1/2 of normal period.","_loserStakeMultiplier":"Losers stake multiplier.","_winnerStakeMultiplier":"Winners stake multiplier.","divisor":"Multiplier divisor in basis points."}},"getNumberOfRounds(uint256)":{"details":"Get the number of rounds of a local disputes.","params":{"_localDisputeID":"The index of the dispute in the array of disputes."},"returns":{"_0":"The number of rounds of the dispute."}},"getRoundInfo(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Get the information of a round of a dispute.","params":{"_localDisputeID":"The index of the dispute in the array of disputes.","_round":"The round to query."},"returns":{"appealed":"Whether the round was appealed.","feeRewards":"The amount of fees to use as rewards.","paidFees":"Total fees paid in this round.","sideFunded":"The party that paid the appeal fees first."}},"getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,address,uint256[])":{"details":"Returns the sum of withdrawable amount. This function is O(n) where n is the number of rounds. This could exceed the gas limit,  therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.","params":{"_contributor":"The contributor for which to query.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes."},"returns":{"sum":"The total amount available to withdraw."}},"initialize(address,bytes,address,string,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Constructor.","params":{"_arbitrator":"The arbitrator of the contract.","_arbitratorExtraData":"Extra data for the arbitrator.","_challengeTimeout":"Time in seconds during which it is possible to challenge a claim.","_claimantMultiplier":"Multiplier for calculating the deposit of the claimant.","_claims":"The address of Claims.sol contract.","_loserStakeMultiplier":"Multiplier of the arbitration cost that the loser has to pay as fee stake for a round in basis points.","_metaEvidence":"The URI of the meta evidence object.","_minimumDeposit":"The minimum deposit the claimant has to pay if the claimed amount is too low.","_readjustmentTimeout":"Time in seconds during which it is possible to readjust the amount of the claim.","_winnerStakeMultiplier":"Multiplier of the arbitration cost that the winner has to pay as fee stake for a round in basis points. Also applies in case of a draw."}},"joinGroupClaim(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Join a new claim group. Can only be called once per claim.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the claim for which group is to be changed.","_groupClaimId":"The ID of the new claim group."}},"makeNewClaim(address,uint256,bool,string[],uint256)":{"details":"Make a new claim in Connector and Claims contracts. Requires the fraction of the claimed amount as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.","params":{"_amount":"The claimed amount.","_dappCover":"True if the claim is covered by the dapp.","_evidences":"A list of links to evidence using its URI. Ignored if not provided. If claim is first of the incident, the incident url has to be the first element","_incidentGroupClaimId":"id connecting all the claims in the same incident, groupClaimId of the first claim in the incident if == uint256(-1) it means that this claim is the first in the incident","_marketAddress":"The address of the market contract claimed"}},"makeNewClaimAndJoinGroup(address,uint256,uint256,string[])":{"details":"Make a new claim and join an existing claim group. Requires the fraction of the claimed amount as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.","params":{"_amount":"Claimed amount.","_evidences":"A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided.","_groupClaimId":"The ID of the group to join in Claims contract.","_marketAddress":"The address of the market contract."}},"numberOfRulingOptions(uint256)":{"details":"Returns number of possible ruling options.","returns":{"_0":"count The number of ruling options."}},"readjustClaim(uint256,uint256,string[])":{"details":"Change the claimed amount. Resets the claim to its initial state and makes it open for a new challenge. Can only be called once per claim and after the claim has been declined.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the claim which amount to readjust.","_evidences":"A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided.","_newAmount":"The new amount to claim."}},"refuseClaim(uint256)":{"details":"Refuse the claim that wasn't readjusted during the readjustment period.","params":{"_claimID":"The ID of the claim."}},"rule(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Give a ruling for a dispute. Can only be called by the arbitrator. TRUSTED. Accounts for the situation where the winner loses a case due to paying less appeal fees than expected.","params":{"_disputeID":"ID of the dispute in the arbitrator contract.","_ruling":"Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for \"Refused to arbitrate\"."}},"setClaimsContract(address)":{"details":"Set the address of the Claims contract.","params":{"_claims":"The address of the Claims contract."}},"setOracle(address,address)":{"details":"Map the address of the oracle to a specific token.","params":{"_oracle":"The address of the oracle to convert tokens into ETH.","_token":"The address of the token."}},"submitEvidence(uint256,string)":{"details":"Submit a reference to evidence. EVENT.","params":{"_evidenceURI":"Link to evidence.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes."}},"submitMultipleEvidence(uint256,string[])":{"details":"Submit a reference to evidence. EVENT. This function accept multiple evidence URIs at once. ","params":{"_evidences":"A list of links to evidences using its URIs.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes."}},"withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Reimburse contributions if no disputes were raised in Arbitrator contract. If a dispute was raised, send the fee stake rewards and reimbursements proportionally to the contributions made to the winner of a dispute.","params":{"_beneficiary":"The address that made contributions.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.","_round":"The round from which to withdraw.","_ruling":"The ruling to withdraw from."},"returns":{"reward":"The withdrawn reward value."}},"withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint256,address,uint256[])":{"details":"Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For multiple rulings options and for all rounds at once. This function is O(n) where n is the number of rounds. This could exceed the gas limit, therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.","params":{"_contributedTo":"Rulings that received contributions from contributor. Not used in this contract.","_contributor":"The address to withdraw rewards for.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes."}},"withdrawFeesAndRewardsForMultipleRulings(uint256,address,uint256,uint256[])":{"details":"Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved for multiple ruling options at once. Note that since this arbitrable contract only has 2 ruling options using this function isn't practical. It's implemented to match Dispute Resolver interface.","params":{"_contributor":"The address to withdraw rewards for.","_localDisputeID":"The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.","_roundNumber":"The number of the round caller wants to withdraw 74fd23f654e78213092dd001b33a10abfae4a8b11","dweb:/ipfs/QmNxiqwTfeH4Vp6FXCn373gYRCddBEjbFLwkoYTRZEcYAm"]},"@kleros/erc-792/contracts/IArbitrator.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5d7ee1ae667b975fd2600d2014a52836c2a5df0134c5117fd650dff586e9544d","urls":["bzz-raw://896c502f3e3a7c42d60accaa54b7886afea6b2ea47f8dfaee3dc7dbae6b68c87","dweb:/ipfs/QmUUh7i4SSt6i8E395FZUJLUVdZUDkjczjnvsEaKgbzETi"]},"@kleros/erc-792/contracts/erc-1497/IEvidence.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe62d956a5fa0e2c77030b01d99b3323cfc4722a5d0711343961ed8740545fc36","urls":["bzz-raw://4cbcc2670424888dc04740d6480e5504611a0bb71a4aa6d73f941318097a7f20","dweb:/ipfs/QmYuhopwZxtWV5Ms4dWrkNbiF1cmtvqr6XgVMkcMqXYUbw"]},"@kleros/ethereum-libraries/contracts/CappedMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5d26f158bf043d3491acc5e8860bd69a1a9e98c0131fe904c92976990d0f4cc9","urls":["bzz-raw://09222a99ea0b21837698743760ccb8408f0ccedab45224744265b19263bf8b88","dweb:/ipfs/QmW3GCXn3DxWnnxuBdVBKtbCD2fBswPsA1esf2ibnZs1di"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts-ethereum-package/contracts/Initializable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9bfec92e36234ecc99b5d37230acb6cd1f99560233753162204104a4897e8721","urls":["bzz-raw://5cf7c208583d4d046d75bd99f5507412ab01cce9dd9f802ce9768a416d93ea2f","dweb:/ipfs/QmcQS1BBMPpVEkXP3qzwSjxHNrqDek8YeR7xbVWDC9ApC7"]}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: This contract acts a connector between Unslashed and Kleros court. NOTE: This contract trusts that the Arbitrator is honest and will not reenter or modify its costs during a call. The arbitrator must support appeal period. The contract also trusts that Claims and Market contracts are honest and won't reenter.

acceptClaim(uint256).details: Accept the claim that wasn't challenged during the challenge period.

challengeClaim(uint256,string[]).details: Challenge the claim and create a dispute. Requires the value of the arbitration cost as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.

params._claimID: The ID of the claim to challenge.
params._evidences: A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided.

changeChallengeTimeout(uint256).details: Change the duration of the challenge period.

params._challengeTimeout: The new duration of the challenge period.

changeClaimantMultiplier(uint256).details: Change the proportion of the requested amount that must be paid by the claimant in order to create a new claim.

params._claimantMultiplier: The new multiplier for calculating the claimant's deposit. In basis points.

changeGovernor(address).details: Change the governor of the contract.

params._governor: The address of the new governor.

changeLoserStakeMultiplier(uint256).details: Change the proportion of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake by the party that lost the previous round.

params._loserStakeMultiplier: The new multiplier of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake. In basis points.

changeMetaEvidence(string).details: Update the meta evidence used for disputes.

params._metaEvidence: URI of the new meta evidence.

changeMinimumDeposit(uint256).details: Change the minimum deposit the claimant has to pay when the claimed value is too low.

params._minimumDeposit: The new minimum deposit for claimant.

changeReadjustmentTimeout(uint256).details: Change the duration of the readjustment period.

params._readjustmentTimeout: The new duration of the readjustment period.

changeWinnerStakeMultiplier(uint256).details: Change the proportion of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake by the winner of the previous round. Also applies in case of a draw.

params._winnerStakeMultiplier: The new multiplier of arbitration fees that must be paid as fee stake. In basis points.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint256).details: Take up to the total amount required to fund a side of an appeal. Reimburse the rest. Create an appeal if both sides are fully funded.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.

returns.fullyFunded: Whether the side of an appeal was fully funded or not.

getAppealCost(uint256).details: Get the cost of appeal of the claims' dispute.

params._claimID: The ID of the associated claim.

returns.appealCost: to be paid. Note that this cost doesn't include crowdfunding fees.

getChallengeCost(uint256).details: Get the deposit required for challenging the claim.

params._claimID: The ID of the associated claim.

getClaimCost(address,uint256).details: Get the cost of making a claim.

params._marketAddress: The address of the market to define the token address.

returns.deposit: The fraction of the claimed amount converted into ETH.

getClaimantDeposit(address,uint256).details: Get the required deposit for the claimant.

params._amount: The amount to convert into ETH.
params._marketAddress: The address of the market to define the token address.

returns._0: The deposit the claimant has to pay.

getContributions(uint256,uint256,address.details: Get the contributions made by a party for a given round of a dispute.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the dispute in the array of disputes.

returns._loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: Multiplier for calculating the duration of the appeal period for losing side. This contract uses default 1/2 of normal period.

getNumberOfRounds(uint256).details: Get the number of rounds of a local disputes.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the dispute in the array of disputes.

returns._0: The number of rounds of the dispute.

getRoundInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Get the information of a round of a dispute.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the dispute in the array of disputes.

returns.feeRewards: The amount of fees to use as rewards.
returns.paidFees: Total fees paid in this round.
returns.sideFunded: The party that paid the appeal fees first.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.details: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount. This function is O(n) where n is the number of rounds. This could exceed the gas limit,  therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.

params._contributor: The contributor for which to query.
params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

params._challengeTimeout: Time in seconds during which it is possible to challenge a claim.
params._claimantMultiplier: Multiplier for calculating the deposit of the claimant.
params._loserStakeMultiplier: Multiplier of the arbitration cost that the loser has to pay as fee stake for a round in basis points.
params._metaEvidence: The URI of the meta evidence object.
params._minimumDeposit: The minimum deposit the claimant has to pay if the claimed amount is too low.
params._readjustmentTimeout: Time in seconds during which it is possible to readjust the amount of the claim.
params._winnerStakeMultiplier: Multiplier of the arbitration cost that the winner has to pay as fee stake for a round in basis points. Also applies in case of a draw.

joinGroupClaim(uint256,uint256).details: Join a new claim group. Can only be called once per claim.

params._claimID: The ID of the claim for which group is to be changed.
params._groupClaimId: The ID of the new claim group.

makeNewClaim(address,uint256,bool,string.details: Make a new claim in Connector and Claims contracts. Requires the fraction of the claimed amount as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.

params._dappCover: True if the claim is covered by the dapp.
params._evidences: A list of links to evidence using its URI. Ignored if not provided. If claim is first of the incident, the incident url has to be the first element
params._incidentGroupClaimId: id connecting all the claims in the same incident, groupClaimId of the first claim in the incident if == uint256(-1) it means that this claim is the first in the incident
params._marketAddress: The address of the market contract claimed

makeNewClaimAndJoinGroup(address,uint256.details: Make a new claim and join an existing claim group. Requires the fraction of the claimed amount as a deposit. Accepts enough ETH to cover the deposit, reimburses the rest.

params._evidences: A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided.
params._groupClaimId: The ID of the group to join in Claims contract.
params._marketAddress: The address of the market contract.

numberOfRulingOptions(uint256).details: Returns number of possible ruling options.

returns._0: count The number of ruling options.

readjustClaim(uint256,uint256,string[]).details: Change the claimed amount. Resets the claim to its initial state and makes it open for a new challenge. Can only be called once per claim and after the claim has been declined.

params._claimID: The ID of the claim which amount to readjust.
params._evidences: A list of links to evidences using its URIs. Ignored if not provided.

refuseClaim(uint256).details: Refuse the claim that wasn't readjusted during the readjustment period.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Can only be called by the arbitrator. TRUSTED. Accounts for the situation where the winner loses a case due to paying less appeal fees than expected.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Refused to arbitrate".

setClaimsContract(address).details: Set the address of the Claims contract.

params._claims: The address of the Claims contract.

setOracle(address,address).details: Map the address of the oracle to a specific token.

params._oracle: The address of the oracle to convert tokens into ETH.

submitEvidence(uint256,string).details: Submit a reference to evidence. EVENT.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.

submitMultipleEvidence(uint256,string[]).details: Submit a reference to evidence. EVENT. This function accept multiple evidence URIs at once.

params._evidences: A list of links to evidences using its URIs.
params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.details: Reimburse contributions if no disputes were raised in Arbitrator contract. If a dispute was raised, send the fee stake rewards and reimbursements proportionally to the contributions made to the winner of a dispute.

params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.
params._round: The round from which to withdraw.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For multiple rulings options and for all rounds at once. This function is O(n) where n is the number of rounds. This could exceed the gas limit, therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.

params._contributedTo: Rulings that received contributions from contributor. Not used in this contract.
params._contributor: The address to withdraw rewards for.
params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForMultipleRulings.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved for multiple ruling options at once. Note that since this arbitrable contract only has 2 ruling options using this function isn't practical. It's implemented to match Dispute Resolver interface.

params._contributor: The address to withdraw rewards for.
params._localDisputeID: The index of the related dispute in the array of disputes.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.

devdoc.title: KlerosConnector
